message.content:
cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.ET

Reasoning: 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes an optimal control method for regulating On-Load Tap Changers (OLTCs) to mitigate over-voltage issues caused by high solar Photovoltaic (PV) penetration on distribution systems. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The proposed method uses voltage forecasts derived from high resolution PV generation forecasts, which could involve machine learning or other AI techniques. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper mentions simulations on a PC, which could involve distributed or parallel computing. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper describes the implementation of the proposed method using a linearization technique to make the optimization problem convex and able to be solved at operational timescales. 
- cs.ET (Emerging Technologies): The paper addresses the issue of high solar PV penetration on distribution systems, which is a topic related to emerging technologies in the energy sector.
